lines.text: We're falling 2,000 feet!
It's all right, dear. Don't start worrying 'til we get down 1,999. The last foot is dangerous.
I didn't squawk about the steak, dear. I merely said I didn't see that old horse that used to be tethered outside here.
You're as funny as a cry for help.
You're about to fall heir to a kitten's stocking.
What's a kitten's stocking?
A sock on the puss.
How'd you like to hide the egg and gurgitate a few saucers of mocha java?
And another thing. Don't be so free with your hands.
Listen, honey. I was only trying to guess your weight. You take things too seriously.
Some day you'll drown in a vat of whiskey!
Drown in a vat of whiskey. Death, where is thy sting?

[Suffering from a hangover]
Somebody put too many olives in my martini last night!
Should I get you a Bromo?
No, I couldn't stand the noise!

[Discussing his proposed script]
In a circus scene you wear a beard.
I wear a beard?
Yeah, a small beard - a van dyke. Just a little... You know what a van dyke is, don't you?
I certainly do!
Ooh.
Do you want to grow up and be dumb like Zasu Pitts?
Oh, for a Maxwell parachute!
What's a Maxwell parachute?
Good until the last drop, dear.

[to the Great Man]
You're as funny as a cry for help! You also pulled that old gag about breaking your fork in the gravy!

[Sitting at a luncheonette table]
I don't know why I ever come in here. Flies get the best of everything!
Oh, you're so full of romance!
Every night, every night.
I didn't sleep well last night.
You didn't, eh?
I'm troubled with insomnia.
Oh, insomnia! Ah, well, I know a good cure for it.
Yeah?
Get plenty of sleep.
Sleep, unh?
That's what a doctor told me, heh, heh.
You know, there's something awfully big about you.
Hunh-huh. Thank you, dear, thank you, dear, thaank...

[Interrupting]
Your nose!

[after she turns her back to him, he stares at her derriere]
Something awfully big about you too!
Why didn't you ever marry?
I was in love with a beautiful blonde once, dear. She drove me to drink. That's the one thing I'm indebted to her for.
This script is an insult to a man's intelligence. Even mine.
Suffering sciatica! Last time is was pink elephants.

[in the soda fountain]
I feel as though somebody stepped on my tongue with muddy feet.
[to the camera]
This scene's supposed to be in a saloon but the censor cut it out. It'll play just as well this way.
Where do you think you're going, to a fire?
Ah... Ah... maternity hospital.
Okay, Tomato-Puss, follow me.

[as things turn into chaos, at Fields' instigation, shaking her head]
My uncle Bill...
[then, resolute]
But I still love him!
Do you think he drinks?
He didn't get that nose from playing ping-pong.
Are you really a man?
Well, I've been called other things...
Have, uh, you any imported cigars?
'Stingeroos', four for a nickel.
Oh, that's fine. As long as they're imported.
[she holds out box of cigars, he takes four]
You know, if anybody ever comes in here and gives you a ten dollar tip... uh, scrutinize it carefully. There's a lot of that counterfeit money going around.
[she holds out her hand for the money for the cigars]
I'll give you the dough. Don't...
[puts a coin in her hand]
Here... there.
If I get any counterfeit nickels or pennies, I'll know where they came from
The only game I've ever played is bean-bag.
Bean-bag... ah, it's very good. Becomes very exciting at times. I saw the championship played in Paris; many people were killed.
[they're in the basket trying to figure out how to get it pulled up to the mountaintop - a rock falls on his head]
Did it hurt you, uncle?
No... how could a rock dropping from a thousand feet hurt your head?

[to an Englishman who has a limp in his walk]
Whatsa matter? Did you sprain your ankle?
No, no, no. A dog bit, bit me.
Oh.
Yeah, I was playing, uh, croquet and I, and I dropped my mallet. And, uh, a little dachshund ran straight out and uh, and, and grabbed me by the fetlock.
[Bending over to point to his ankle]
Oh.
[Looking BEHIND him in the bent-over position]
Rather fortunate it wasn't a Newfoundland dog that bit you.
Uh, yes, rahther.
Yeah.
I suppose so.
Godfrey Daniel!

[Last Lines]
My Uncle Bill. But I still love him.
